data.text: @poojagarg1111 I had Covid Nov.'20. Since, when I am exhausted and then have a moment of sudden stress, I smell a phantom scent. The same every time; it can last for up to 30 minutes. A very strong peppery/metallic/ sulphur mix. It sometimes even burns my eyes and nose a bit.
@poojagarg1111 @Havenlust Where did I leave my keys

and shrinkage in size equivalent to as much as a decade of normal aging. The changes were linked to cognitive decline in the study, which was published in the journal Nature. The findings represent striking evidence of the virus’s impact on the central nervous system.
